sub_title: Crafting Clarity in a Tech-Driven World | Freelance Technical Writer
summary:
Working online requires a range of skills, so I don't just do copywriting or have a focus on Social Media. My background of experience in coding, editing, content creation and analytics enable me to not only keep challenging myself but also allows me to thrive in a world that is fast-paced and ever changing.  My degree in humantites keeps me grounded. 

Writer, editor and analyst (who takes photos and writes poetry for fun). With previous experience in tehcnical support, journalism, events management, recruitment, marketing & communications.

awards.title: BELA: Basic Expedition Leader's Award
awards.description:
With the Basic Expedition Leaders Award I am trained to:
•Lead walking groups in lowland countryside
•Impart the knowledge and skills needed to undertake a day walk
•Have responsibility for the care of others while leading a day walk in lowland countryside
•Plan and lead overnight base and mobile camps.

I undertook training for this award through my sixth form, and training took place in various local countryside. The final assessment was taken over 3 days at the Malvern Hills Outdoor Education Centre and the surrounding area in December 2009 however the award became valid after full first-aid training in July 2010. 


- See more at: http://www.sportsleaders.org/courses/qualifications/qualifications/level-3-certificate-in-basic-expedition-leadership/introduction/

awards.title: Head Girl
awards.description: During my last year in Middle School I was Head Girl. This was incredible as I had been picked over every other student in my school. It is also considered an honour to have this position in UK schools. As head girl I was there to greet any noteable guests for events and such things, as well as undertake responsibilities around school.

projects.title: Euregio 2018 - Youth Participation
projects.description:
I participated in a group discussion which involved the winners of the Charlemagne Youth Prize and young people from the Euregio Meuse-Rhine. My particular group focused on the problem of adminstrative Europe - is it adaptive and does it learn? 
The group consisted of participants of the Charlemagne Youth Prize, who run various projects which aim to unite Europe, and young people from the area of Maastricht (which included myself) who have experience in the themes of globalisation, integration and critical thinking. 
The conclusion of our discussion was the following:
1. In order to adapt, administrative Europe should familiarise itself with the target group it is aiming for, in this case young people, who in many cases do know of or even care about the administrative part of Europe. Once they know their target group institutions like the European Parliament can amend their information and communication in order to better fit their audience. 
2. Administrative Europe should focus on communicating the shared values of different member states, as this seems to be lacking in current information and policies. This is important because shared values would create an idea of unity among voters, instead of the current situation where the majority of young people base their european 'ideas' or stereotypes on what they see in the media.

projects.title: Global Perspectives: Academic Skills Mentoring
projects.description: The purpose of this project is to mentor high school students in academic research and skills training in order to prepare them for the world of university education. Over two days I will be guding a groop of students through the process of completing a well-written, academically sound Independent Research Report.

contributors.headline: Crafting Clarity in a Tech-Driven World | Freelance Technical Writer

projects.title: Apeldoorn British-Dutch Dialogue 2013
projects.description:
As contributor at the Apeldoorn 2013 British-Dutch Dialogue I attended the three day annual conference in Eindhoven, the Netherlands. My background in freelance writing, marketing and the arts helped me massively in understanding, and taking part in the conference. I was able to gain the relevant information for the official report as part of a team and develop my understanding of British-Dutch communication. 

The theme was extremely interesting and very relevant to the Eindhoven area: Creativity, Innovation and Entrepreneurship in the UK and the Netherlands. I found this theme particularly interesting as it covers the areas I particularly work in, and can be applied to almost any of my future career choices. I also found the variety of attendees extremely insightful as there were guests from all levels of business, government organisations, NGO's and education. This made for rich and beneficial discussions throughout the three day event. 

Writing the official report has helped me in developing my journalistic skills, as well as my networking skills. It was a fantastic opportunity and a pleasure to be involved in such a stimulating, inspirational and engaging conference.

projects.title: Batchley Youth Action Volunteer
projects.description: I helped organise local events aimed at improving the communication between young people and other residents in my local area. There were weekly meetings and team building-days with other volunteers (about 6 of us, this number varied over the two years) which enriched the whole volunteer experience. One such event was a graffiti art day held in the summer aimed and bringing together local residents of all ages to have a go at graffiti art in a safe, controlled area. The artwork is now on display in the local town.

profile_positions.description:
As a Technical Consultant for the regional UK hub of CM.com I:
- Advised existing customers on implementations of new or existing CM Products such as Conversational AI, Payments, Ticketing, Livechat systems
- Work with customers on integrating their systems with CM.com products
- Produce and review sales proposals 
- Advise product teams on regional technical requirements
- Onboard regional colleagues incl. provide hardware locally
- Train colleagues locally regarding CM products, particularly SaaS products
- Local SaaS expert
- Train and onboard new and existing customers with CM software
- JIRA Exterprise expert
- Developing testing matrix for SaaS locally
- Implement a way of working using Monday.com for localised Technical team
- Provide demos and videos for the local Sales team
- Review marketing documentation regarding Conversational AI
- Initiate local partner initiatives
profile_positions.title: Technical Consultant

profile_positions.description:
As a Product Analyst for Conversational AI my role consists of:
- Coordination of meetings & meeting minute taking for various teams
- Core focus on Natural Language Processing maintenance and improvements as part of the Conversational AI platform
- Technical support to the Developers & Support Team
- Introducing automated product analysis and reporting for user story analysis
- Writing & editing technical software documentation
- User Acceptance testing & introducing automated quality testing
- JIRA Federation management & system administration
- Provide Knowledge Transfer to the Support Team
profile_positions.title: Product Analyst

profile_positions.description:
The technical support team is at the centre of the company, and as a result, my work here varies:
- Writing, editing & proofreading technical documentation
- Writing support articles & help guides
- Communication updates & scheduling
- Release management
- Ticket management 
- JIRA Administrator
- Creating and maintaining standard libraries
- Incident handling
- Support Desk management
- Internal Process & ISO preparation
- Develop and improve testing process
- External & Internal Communications handling with regards to the core platform of DigitalCX
profile_positions.title: Technical Support Specialist

profile_positions.description:
Working with CX Company I analyse content concerning the virtual assistants created for various companies. I work across large databases ensuring customers of our clients receive correct information to their questions. 
- Excel worksheets and macro building, including regular reports
- Acute linguistic skills are necessary
- Teamwork is vital to ensure effective maintenance of databases
- Occasional work on foreign language databases
- Attention to detail is required as sometimes errors are incredibly difficult to spot
- Working in an open office environment where work is managed in a transparent way
- JIRA manager for the content, front end and BI teams
profile_positions.title: Senior Content Analyst

profile_positions.description: Writing regular articles for Dutch news (English language) website. This was a fun small project, aimed at helping Dutch Review engage users on a wider scale particularly outside of the Randstad area.

Previous projects have included working with the Cambridge Pre-Academic Experience programme in the Netherlands, as well as proof-reading many bachelor and masters thesis papers.
profile_positions.title: Freelancer

profile_positions.description:
Co-ordinating a support team for UK students who want to study at Maastricht University. Roles include:
- Answering questions from prospective students using ticketing platform
- Attending/speaking at conferences about studying abroad such as the SCIS Independent Schools conference
- Working on press releases
- Communication management
- Lead management
- Organising events for UK students in Maastricht
- Working with different faculties and admissions departments to enable clear communication to UK applicants
- Working with UK press (e.g. BBC, The Sunday Times, The Observer)
- Administration of the team: budgetting, arranging meetings, compiling databases, updating web-page
- Visiting schools in the UK to talk to students about studying abroad
- Organising information days in Maastricht for high school staff and education bodies from the UK
- Hosted the UK Ambassador to the Netherlands in various events and sessions for UK students in Maastricht

volunteer_experiences.description:
As part of my Duke of Edinburgh award I worked at the shop for 3 months. It is a charity shop, so the main role was using the till and helping people find things they want to buy, as well as accepting donations from people. 
I chose this shop because raising money for cancer research has always had an important place in my heart.
